DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF EMBODIMENTS
description.p: FIG. 1 enclosed is a perspective view of the inflatable mattress 10 of the present invention.
FIG. 2 is an exploded view of the components of the inflatable mattress 10 of the present invention.

As shown in FIG. 1 and FIG. 2, the improved inflatable mattress 10 of the present invention comprises an upper leather article 11, a lower leather article 12, a circumferential member 13 and a plurality of connection pieces 20 to form the assembly construction.
As shown in FIG. 2, the upper leather article 11 forms the mattress surface of the mattress 10.
The lower leather article 12 forms the mattress bottom of the mattress 10.
The circumferential member 13 is connected to outer sides of the upper leather article 11 and the lower leather article 12 to form a circumference of the mattress 10.
A sealed hollow mattress body is formed by the upper leather article 11, the lower leather article 12 and the circumferential member 13.

The circumferential member 13 comprises an air valve 30 provided at a suitable portion of the circumferential member 13 for pumping air into or release air from a hollow inner portion of the mattress.

Again, as shown in FIG. 2, each one of the connection pieces 20 is spaced apart from each other in an equal distance and is provided at the hollow inner portion of the sealed mattress body formed by the upper leather article 11, the lower leather article 12 and the circumferential member 13 such that the inflatable mattress 10 is formed.
FIG. 3 enclosed is an enlarged view of the structure of the connection pieces 20 at the inner portion of the inflatable mattress 10 of the present invention.
FIG. 4 is a cross sectional view of the inflatable mattress 10 of the present invention.
FIG. 5 is an enlarged view of the structure of the cross section of the connection pieces 20 at the inner portion of the inflatable mattress 10 in FIG. 4.

As shown in FIG. 3 and FIG. 4, each one of the connection pieces 20 comprises an upper slat 21 and a lower slat 22 with a symmetrical structure; a mesh fabric 23 is provided between the upper slats and the lower slats to connect therebetween.

Again, as shown in FIG. 4 and FIG. 5, each one of the upper slats 21 is connected to the upper leather article of the mattress; each one of the lower slats 22 is connected to the lower leather article of the mattress; with a plurality of connection pieces 20, the upper leather article 11 and the lower leather article 12 of the mattress 10 can be firmly attached together.

As shown in FIG. 3, FIG. 4 and FIG. 5, in terms of the design, the upper slat 21 and the lower slat 22 of each one of the aforementioned connection pieces 20 are of a cross section of a symmetrical Y shape; such design allows the number of the connecting portions (portions with the high frequency melting manufacturing process thereon) between each one of the connection pieces 20 with the upper leather article 11 and the lower leather article 12 of the inflatable mattress 10 to be significantly increased such that the connecting structure between each one of the connection pieces 20 and the inflatable mattress 10 is strengthened.

Again, as shown in FIG. 3, the design of the mesh fabric 23 connected between the upper slat 21 and lower slat 22 of each one of the connection pieces 20 allows the structural strength of each one of the connection pieces 20 itself to be greater and, at the same time, reduces the leather usage of the connection pieces 20 as well such that greater structural strength be obtained with less amount connection pieces 20, which in turn, making the overall weight of the inflatable mattress 10 to be light and achieving the predetermined objectives of the present invention.

For the actual manufacturing, the upper leather article 11, the lower leather article 12 and the circumferential member 13 of the resent invention can be selected from various manufacturing materials including such as PVC, TPU, TPU adhesives, EVA adhesives and other similar materials, which are not limited to a certain type of manufacturing material.

For the connection pieces 20 of the present invention, the upper slats 21 and the lower slats 22 thereof can be made of a material identical to that of the aforementioned upper leather article 11, the lower leather article 12 and the circumferential member 13. The mesh fabric 23 can be a mesh fabric made of polyester or similar material.

In view of the above, the present invention is able to achieve the expected functional objectives and is described in detail to be carried out by the person skilled in the art. Nevertheless, the embodiments above are provided for illustration purposes only; any equivalent structural modifications and amendments without deviating from the spirit of the present invention shall be deemed to be within the scope of the present invention.
